text: <@U01KXU8UNRX> sorry for the delay in getting back on this - Martin replied on Feb 3, but I never got round to reporting back! As you might, expect he's aware  that there is a newer version of Mailman and that a migration ought to happen. However, several hacks have been required to the mailman instance over the years, notably adding a captcha to stop spam attacks and obfuscating emails in all the mailing list archives. Although these hacks are somewhat documented, Martin estimates that it could more than a week of work to port them to Mailman 3 and the migration carries the danger of disruption etc. Given that subscribers can stop password reminders if they choose and moreover choose a unique pass phrase that is not used anywhere else, the benefit of moving isn't high enough to justify Martin spending the time on this. Of course, if there was a willing volunteer with the time and expertise to help manage the migration, the story might be different...
